title: **Part 1 Perfuse the animal and obtain the cryostat sections**

body.body: Deeply anesthetize Sprague-Dawley rats \(P16-20) with 1% sodium pentobarbital.
Briefly perfuse rats through left ventricle with 12-15 ml normal saline and then perfuse with 8-10 ml 1% PFA and 1% sucrose in 0.1 M PB \(Perfusion speed: 7.5 ml per min).

title: **CRITICAL**
body: Make sure that the rat is only lightly fixed.

body.body: Dissect out the brain, then cut the region of interest with a scalpel, fix the block in the same fixative for 2 hours and then immerse in 30% sucrose in 0.1 M PB till it sinks to the bottom of the container.
Obtain cryostat coronal sections \(thickness of 16 or 100 μm) using the freezing microtome.
Let sections dry at room temperature.

title: **CRITICAL**
body: Do not store slices for future use.

body.body: Use the PAP pen to draw a hydrophobic barrier on each glass slide to confine the flow of reagents to the defined area.

title: **Part 2 Prepare and fix the living brain slices**

body.body: Prepare the ACSF and ice-cold sucrose solution \(bubble the solution with 95% O<sub>2</sub> and 5% CO<sub>2</sub> for ~30 min).
Anesthetize the animal deeply with 1% sodium pentobarbital.
Dissect out the brain and place in the ice-cold sucrose solution.
Mount the brain on the vibratome stage with super glue and keep it submerged in the ice-cold sucrose solution.
Cut coronal cortical slices \(thickness of 300-350 μm) with the vibratome \(at a high frequency and low speed) and let them recover for at least 45 min in the aerated ACSF at ~35 °C.
Transfer the slices with the cut-off glass Pasteur pipette into the fixative \(1% PFA and 1% sucrose in 0.1 M PB) and fix for 2 hours.

title: **CRITICAL**
body: Living slices should be used freshly.

body.body: Rinse slices completely \(3x10 min) with 0.01 M PBS in 24-well plate.

title: **TIPS**
body: For floating slice transfer, use the L-shape Pasteur pipette which may cause less damage to the tissue.

body.body: Incubate the sections in a blocking and permeabilizing solution \(5% normal goat serum, 0.3% Triton X-100 in PBS) for 2 hours at room temperature \(20-22 °C).

title: **CRITICAL**
body: For the staining of axon blebs, omit the blocking and permeabilizing step and directly incubate the slices in the primary antibodies.

body.body: Wash the sections in 0.01 M PBS \(3x10 min).

Incubate the sections overnight at 4 °C with primary antibodies against AnkG \(1:200, Santa Cruz) and either Na<sub>v</sub>1.2, Na<sub>v</sub>1.6 or Pan-Na<sub>v</sub> \(1:200, Alomone) in antibody dilution solution.
Wash the sections in 0.01 M PBS \(3x10 min).
Incubate sections at room temperature for 2 hours in Alexa 488 conjugated goat anti-rabbit IgG and Alexa 594 goat anti-mouse IgG in antibody dilution solution \(1:1000, Invitrogen).
Complete wash with 0.01 M PBS \(3x10 min).
Mount sections with the mounting media and take pictures with the confocal microscope.
